title: How to write an invitation letter to invite someone to a country - Quora

response.answer_text: I assume you are referring to a letter to a national of another country (whom does NOT have Visa-free entry to your country) to allow him/her to apply for a visa. I suggest that you first refer to your own equivalent of the Checkpoints or Immigration service. Each country would have different specific requirements but some common factors are: Full Name and identification of inviteeFull name and identification of person inviting.Capacity of person inviting - relative, friend, business manager…Reason and duration of visit, and visit datesWho will be responsible for the invitee - including expenses borne locally and ensuring repatriation.These letters typically start: “To the Visa/ConsulateOfficer{own country} Embassy in {invitee country} Dear Sir: I write in support of the granting of a visa to {invited person and passport details} for a visit to {own country}for the following reasons: etc etc etc etc

My name is BettyNunley and I'm from the United States of America and I would like to invite Alexander Osei Yaw to come here to visit with the possibility of getting married. Please let me know what else we or I need to do to make it possible
